message_1: In a Trust Game, Player A is given 10 points and must decide how many points, X, to send to Player B who receives triple the points that were sent. If Player B then decides to send half of their points back to Player A, what is the maximum amount of points that Player A can receive back?
message_2:
In this situation, the maximum amount of points Player A can receive back is when they send all of their 10 points to Player B. 

When Player A sends 10 points, Player B receives triple the points, which is 3 * 10 = 30 points. 

If Player B decides to send half of their points back to Player A, they will send 30 / 2 = 15 points back.

So, the maximum amount of points that Player A can receive back is 15 points.
